The removal of borders would allow for the free flow of goods and services, leading to increased trade and economic growth. This could help to reduce poverty and improve living standards in developing countries.

Erasing borders could also lead to the establishment of a global government, where international laws and regulations are enforced by a single authority. This could lead to a more efficient and fair system of governance.

The absence of borders could also lead to the development of a global defense force, where military personnel from all countries work together to protect the world from threats such as terrorism and natural disasters.
The removal of borders could also lead to the creation of a global education system, where students from all over the world can study together and share knowledge and ideas.
The erasure of borders could also lead to the development of a global healthcare system, where patients from all over the world can receive medical treatment in any country.
